training_qas.question: Can you build a settlement on the first turn?
relevant_chunks: The first player places 1 settlement on an empty intersection of their choice.
training_qas.answer: Yes, each player may place one settlement at the start of the game.

training_qas.question: Can you use Year of Plenty to take two of the same resource?
relevant_chunks: When you play this card, take any 2 resource cards from the supply. Add them to your hand. They may be 2 of the same resource or 2 different resources.
training_qas.answer: Yes, you may choose any two, even duplicates.

training_qas.question: What does the Monopoly card do?
relevant_chunks: When you play this card, announce one type of resource. Each player must give you all their resource cards of that type.
training_qas.answer: It lets you take all cards of one resource type from every player.

training_qas.question: Can you build a city without a settlement?
relevant_chunks: Cities always replace settlements.
training_qas.answer: Yes, as long as you have enough resources.

training_qas.question: Can you steal from a player with no resource cards?
relevant_chunks: Steal 1 random resource card from a player who has a building on that hex.
training_qas.answer: Yes, but you get nothing.

training_qas.question: Can you win by revealing multiple Victory Point cards mid-turn?
relevant_chunks: Reveal all your Victory Point cards, including any built this turn, if you can reach the number of VPs needed to win.
Turn over any number of Victory Point cards, including ones built this turn, to show that you have reached 10 VPs.
training_qas.answer: Yes, you can reveal them anytime to reach 10 points and win.

training_qas.question: Can you trade after building?
relevant_chunks: You may take actions in this phase as often as you like and in any order, as long as you have the resources to do so.
training_qas.answer: Yes, you can trade and build in any order.

training_qas.question: Can you downgrade a city back to a settlement?
relevant_chunks: Cities always replace settlements. To build a city, remove one of your settlements from the board, return it to your player area, and place your city where the settlement was located.
training_qas.answer: No, upgrades are permanent.

training_qas.question: Can you use a harbor without building a settlement there?
relevant_chunks: If you have a building on a 3:1 port, you may put 3 of the same resource cards into the supply and take 1 card of a different resource from the supply.
training_qas.answer: No, you must control the harbor with a settlement or city.

training_qas.question: Can you build a road through another player's settlement?
relevant_chunks: You may not build a road starting on the other side of an opponent's building.
training_qas.answer: No, you cannot pass through another player's settlement or city.

training_qas.question: Do hexes produce resources when a 7 is rolled?
relevant_chunks: When you roll a 7, hexes do not produce any resources.
training_qas.answer: No. A roll of 7 triggers robber actions instead, and no hex produces resources.

training_qas.question: Can you play a development card on the same turn you buy it?
relevant_chunks: Not on the turn you bought it
training_qas.answer: No. You must wait until a later turn to play it, unless it is a Victory Point card.

training_qas.question: How many resource cards does a city receive from a producing hex?
relevant_chunks: Similarly, a player receives 2 resource cards for each of their cities on that hex.
training_qas.answer: A city produces 2 resource cards when its hex number is rolled.

training_qas.question: Can players trade with each other when it is not their turn?
relevant_chunks: During your turn, other players may only trade with you, not with each other or with the supply.
training_qas.answer: No. Other players may only trade with the active player, not with each other.

training_qas.question: Are you allowed to give resources away for free as a trade?
relevant_chunks: Important: You may not give away cards in any way, which includes trading matching resource cards
training_qas.answer: No. You cannot give away cards; trades must be legitimate exchanges.

training_qas.question: Does the robber block resource production on its hex?
relevant_chunks: Important: A hex with the robber does not produce resources when its number is rolled.
training_qas.answer: Yes. Any hex containing the robber produces nothing.

training_qas.question: Can you build a settlement directly next to another settlement?
relevant_chunks: The Distance Rule: When placing a settlement, stay at least two edges away from all other buildings!
training_qas.answer: No. Settlements must follow the Distance Rule and be two edges apart.

training_qas.question: Can you build a road that doesn’t connect to your existing network?
relevant_chunks: A new road must connect to one of your existing roads or buildings.
training_qas.answer: No. All new roads must continue from your existing roads or buildings.

training_qas.question: Do development cards count toward your hand size when a 7 is rolled?
relevant_chunks: Development cards stay hidden until used. They do not count toward the number of cards in your hand when a 7 is rolled
training_qas.answer: No. Development cards are not counted when checking the 7-card discard rule.

training_qas.question: Can a player immediately lose the Longest Route bonus if their route is broken?
relevant_chunks: If, when a player’s route is broken (see example), they no longer meet the requirements for the Longest Route, the tile is returned to the supply.
training_qas.answer: Yes. If their route is broken and they no longer qualify, the tile is returned.

training_qas.question: How do you determine which hexes produce resources each turn?
relevant_chunks: Roll both dice and add them together. This total determines which hexes produce resources this turn.
training_qas.answer: You roll two dice, and the sum indicates which hexes produce.

training_qas.question: What happens if the supply does not have enough resource cards for all players?
relevant_chunks: If there are not enough resource cards in the supply to fulfill everyone’s production, then no one receives any of that resource.
training_qas.answer: If there aren't enough cards, nobody receives that resource unless only one player was affected.

training_qas.question: Can you choose any player to steal from when activating the robber?
relevant_chunks: If multiple players have buildings on the new hex, you choose one player to rob.
training_qas.answer: Yes. If several players are adjacent to the robber’s hex, you may choose which one to steal from.

training_qas.question: Can a settlement be placed anywhere on an empty intersection?
relevant_chunks: Settlements are placed on empty intersections. A new settlement must follow the Distance Rule
training_qas.answer: No. Settlements must be on empty intersections and also obey the Distance Rule.

training_qas.question: How many settlements can a player build before needing to upgrade to cities?
relevant_chunks: You have 5 settlement pieces. To continue building more settlements, you must first upgrade one to a city.
training_qas.answer: You can only have five settlements; to build more, you must convert one into a city first.

training_qas.question: Does the desert produce any resources?
relevant_chunks: The desert produces nothing
training_qas.answer: No. The desert hex never produces resources.

training_qas.question: Can a road be placed on any empty edge?
relevant_chunks: Roads are placed on empty hex edges. A new road must connect to one of your existing roads or buildings.
training_qas.answer: Only if it connects to your existing road or building network.

training_qas.question: Can a player use a 3:1 port to trade any three identical resources?
relevant_chunks: If you have a building on a 3:1 port, you may put 3 of the same resource cards into the supply and take 1 card of a different resource from the supply.
training_qas.answer: Yes. A 3:1 port allows trading any three matching resources for any one resource.

training_qas.question: When does the game immediately end?
relevant_chunks: If you have 10 or more VPs at any point during your turn, the game ends immediately and you are the winner!
training_qas.answer: As soon as a player reaches 10 victory points during their turn.

training_qas.question: Are you allowed to play a development card before rolling the dice?
training_qas.answer: Yes. You may play one development card before your dice roll.

training_qas.question: What must players do if they have more than 7 resource cards when a 7 is rolled?
relevant_chunks: Each player who has more than 7 resource cards must choose half (rounded down) of their resource cards and return them to the supply.
training_qas.answer: They must discard half of their resource cards, rounded down.

training_qas.question: When placing your starting settlements, how far must you stay from other settlements?
relevant_chunks: Important: When placing a settlement, stay two edges away from all other settlements.
training_qas.answer: You must remain at least two edges away from all other settlements.

training_qas.question: Can you trade 2 wheat for 1 ore if you do not have a wheat port?
relevant_chunks: they may not trade 2 wheat for 1 ore because they do not have a building on the 2:1 wheat port.
training_qas.answer: No, you cannot trade 2:1 unless you control the correct port.

training_qas.question: How many development cards can you play on a single turn?
relevant_chunks: Only 1 development card per turn
training_qas.answer: Only one development card may be played per turn.

training_qas.question: What happens when you play a Knight card?
relevant_chunks: When you play a Knight card, you must “Activate the Robber”
training_qas.answer: You move the robber and then steal one random card from a player on that hex.

training_qas.question: Do development cards ever return to the supply?
relevant_chunks: Development cards never go back into the supply.
training_qas.answer: No. Once purchased, they are never returned to the supply.

training_qas.question: Can you build more than 4 cities during the game?
relevant_chunks: You have 4 cities and may not build more.
training_qas.answer: No. You are limited to the 4 city pieces you begin with.

training_qas.question: What must a new road connect to when you build it?
relevant_chunks: A new road must connect to one of your existing roads or buildings.
training_qas.answer: A newly built road must connect to one of your own existing roads or buildings.

training_qas.question: Are you allowed to trade development cards?
relevant_chunks: You may not trade or give away development cards.
training_qas.answer: No. Development cards cannot be traded or given away.

training_qas.question: During your Action phase, are you restricted to a fixed order of actions?
relevant_chunks: You may take actions in this phase as often as you like and in any order, as long as you have the resources to do so.
training_qas.answer: No. You may take actions in any order and as often as you wish.
